article.headline: Holy Cross 67, Fairfield 65 (OT)
article.story: WORCESTER, Mass. (AP) -- Torey Thomas sank two foul shots with 2.9 seconds left to give Holy Cross a 67-65 overtime win over Fairfield in the Crusaders' season opener on Sunday. Thomas, who led Holy Cross with 20 points, was fouled near the Crusaders' bench, setting up the free throws after Fairfield's Greg Nero tied the score 65-65 with just under 35 seconds remaining. In regulation, Fairfield (0-2) had a chance to win when Dan Oglesby hit a free throw to tie the score 56-56 but missed the second. Oglesby was fouled while rebounding Michael Van Schaick's 3-point attempt with less than a second remaining. In the overtime session, the Stags pulled out to 63-59 lead following a pair of Nero foul shots, but the Crusaders controlled the next two minutes. With 1:19 left, Thomas stole the ball and fed Keith Simmons, whose 3-pointer tied the score 63-63. Thomas hit two free throws on Holy Cross' next possession to give the Crusaders a 65-63 lead.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.
